definitions.definition: The monomer constituting DNA or RNA biopolymer molecules . Each nucleotide consists of a nitrogenous heterocyclic base (or nucleobase ), which can be either a double-ringed purine or a single-ringed pyrimidine ; a five-carbon pentose sugar ( deoxyribose in DNA or ribose in RNA ); and a phosphate group.

main_definition: ( biochemistry ) The monomer constituting DNA or RNA biopolymer molecules . Each nucleotide consists of a nitrogenous heterocyclic base (or nucleobase ), which can be either a double-ringed purine or a single-ringed pyrimidine ; a five-carbon pentose sugar ( deoxyribose in DNA or ribose in RNA ); and a phosphate group.
